title: flesci concretization failure with intel for harfbuzz

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
I am trying to install flecsi which is part of E4S package and this fails to in concretization step at harfbuzz and i see in harfbuzz there is a conflict with version 2.3.1 or higher 

```
    conflicts('%intel', when='@2.3.1:',
              msg='harfbuzz-2.3.1 does not build with the Intel compiler')
```


### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ siddiq90@cori05:/global/u1/s/siddiq90/tmp2/spack/var/spack/environments/e4s> git rev-parse HEAD
09d0623be924ad72eb63342b733c14431208c323
$ siddiq90@cori05:/global/u1/s/siddiq90/tmp2/spack/var/spack/environments/e4s> spack spec flecsi@1 +cinch +coverage +doc +doxygen +graphviz +hdf5 +tutorial
Input spec
--------------------------------
flecsi@1+cinch+coverage+doc+doxygen+graphviz+hdf5+tutorial

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: Conflicts in concretized spec "flecsi@1%intel@19.1.2.254~caliper+cinch+coverage~debug_backend+doc+doxygen~flecstan~flog+graphviz+hdf5~minimal+shared+tutorial backend=mpi build_type=Release arch=cray-cnl7-haswell/jkklcnx"

List of matching conflicts for spec:

    freetype@2.10.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
        ^bzip2@1.0.8%intel@19.1.2.254+shared arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
        ^libpng@1.6.37%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
        ^pkg-config@0.29.2%intel@19.1.2.254+internal_glib arch=cray-cnl7-haswell

1. "%intel" conflicts with "freetype@2.8:" [freetype-2.8 and above cannot be built with icc (does not support __builtin_shuffle)]
List of matching conflicts for spec:

    harfbuzz@2.6.8%intel@19.1.2.254~graphite2 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
        ^cairo@1.16.0%intel@19.1.2.254+X+fc+ft+gobject+pdf~png~svg patches=7c4da77767fe9feb03f8051def0832f0c67f99162913275cfa127a88df19cf51 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^autoconf@2.69%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^m4@1.4.18%intel@19.1.2.254+sigsegv patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^perl@5.30.3%intel@19.1.2.254+cpanm+shared+threads arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^automake@1.16.2%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^fontconfig@2.13.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^font-util@1.3.2%intel@19.1.2.254 fonts=encodings,font-adobe-100dpi,font-adobe-75dpi,font-adobe-utopia-100dpi,font-adobe-utopia-75dpi,font-adobe-utopia-type1,font-alias,font-arabic-misc,font-bh-100dpi,font-bh-75dpi,font-bh-lucidatypewriter-100dpi,font-bh-lucidatypewriter-75dpi,font-bh-ttf,font-bh-type1,font-bitstream-100dpi,font-bitstream-75dpi,font-bitstream-speedo,font-bitstream-type1,font-cronyx-cyrillic,font-cursor-misc,font-daewoo-misc,font-dec-misc,font-ibm-type1,font-isas-misc,font-jis-misc,font-micro-misc,font-misc-cyrillic,font-misc-ethiopic,font-misc-meltho,font-misc-misc,font-mutt-misc,font-schumacher-misc,font-screen-cyrillic,font-sun-misc,font-winitzki-cyrillic,font-xfree86-type1 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^bdftopcf@1.0.5%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                        ^fontsproto@2.1.3%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^pkg-config@0.29.2%intel@19.1.2.254+internal_glib arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^util-macros@1.19.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                        ^libxfont@1.5.2%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^freetype@2.10.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                                ^bzip2@1.0.8%intel@19.1.2.254+shared arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                                ^libpng@1.6.37%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^libfontenc@1.1.3%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                                ^xproto@7.0.31%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                                ^zlib@1.2.11%intel@19.1.2.254+optimize+pic+shared arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^xtrans@1.3.5%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^mkfontdir@1.0.7%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                        ^mkfontscale@1.1.2%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^gperf@3.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^libuuid@1.0.3%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^libxml2@2.9.10%intel@19.1.2.254~python arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^libiconv@1.16%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^xz@5.2.5%intel@19.1.2.254~pic arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^glib@2.64.5%intel@19.1.2.254~libmount patches=63e5a3efbdaf67cfb9707a20fd6e21e8826d1c785b20c6ec326f6d2b116950fc tracing=none arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^gettext@0.21%intel@19.1.2.254+bzip2+curses+git~libunistring+libxml2+tar+xz arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^libffi@3.3%intel@19.1.2.254 patches=26f26c6f29a7ce9bf370ad3ab2610f99365b4bdd7b82e7c31df41a3370d685c0 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^meson@0.55.1%intel@19.1.2.254 patches=45c35fce59361a994c49f8d3f5fd2595fc1b181ba4b5e219b7563752dd879a3b arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^ninja@1.10.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                        ^python@3.8.5%intel@19.1.2.254+bz2+ctypes+dbm~debug+libxml2+lzma~nis~optimizations+pic+pyexpat+pythoncmd+readline+shared+sqlite3+ssl~tix~tkinter~ucs4+uuid+zlib patches=0d98e93189bc278fbc37a50ed7f183bd8aaf249a8e1670a465f0db6bb4f8cf87,ebdca648c9c1d25f586d7e2a495b62e6d91973b55264a13d89eda1beff72ef56 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^expat@2.2.9%intel@19.1.2.254+libbsd arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                                ^libbsd@0.10.0%intel@19.1.2.254 patches=71b49f52a01420ab632f23373135853a2565f88725fb77e625a7fbf7ea812eef arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^gdbm@1.18.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                                ^readline@8.0%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^ncurses@6.2%intel@19.1.2.254~symlinks+termlib arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^openssl@1.1.1g%intel@19.1.2.254+systemcerts arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                            ^sqlite@3.31.1%intel@19.1.2.254+column_metadata+fts~functions~rtree arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^py-setuptools@50.1.0%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^pcre@8.44%intel@19.1.2.254~jit+multibyte+utf arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^libtool@2.4.6%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^libx11@1.6.7%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^inputproto@2.3.2%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^kbproto@1.0.7%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^libxcb@1.13%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^libpthread-stubs@0.4%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^libxau@1.0.8%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^libxdmcp@1.1.2%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                    ^xcb-proto@1.13%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^xextproto@7.3.0%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^libxext@1.3.3%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^libxrender@0.9.10%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
                ^renderproto@0.11.1%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
            ^pixman@0.40.0%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell
        ^icu4c@67.1%intel@19.1.2.254 cxxstd=11 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell

2. "%intel" conflicts with "harfbuzz@2.3.1:" [harfbuzz-2.3.1 does not build with the Intel compiler]
...
```

### Information on your system

```
$ siddiq90@cori05:/global/u1/s/siddiq90/tmp2/spack/var/spack/environments/e4s> spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.4-1311-09d0623be
* **Python:** 3.6.10
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-haswell
```

My spack.yaml is the following

```
# This is a Spack Environment file.
#
# It describes a set of packages to be installed, along with
# configuration settings.
spack:
  view: false
  config:
    install_tree: $spack/$padding:512
    build_stage: $tempdir/$user/spack-stage
    misc_cache: $spack/misc_cache
  'mirrors:':
    e4s-2020-10: /global/common/software/spackecp/mirrors/e4s-2020-10-spack-${COMMIT_SHA}
  definitions:
  - e4s:
    - adios@1.13.1 +netcdf +szip +fortran +bzip2
    - adios2@2.6.0
    - aml@0.1.0
    
    # - ascent@develop skipping package because its on develop
    - axom@0.3.3
    - bolt@1.0
    - caliper@2.3.0
    - darshan-runtime@3.2.1 +slurm
    - darshan-util@3.2.1 +bzip2
    
    # - dyninst@10.2.0 +static
    - faodel@1.1906.1 network=libfabric
    - flecsi@1 +cinch +coverage +doc +doxygen +graphviz +hdf5 +tutorial
    - globalarrays@5.7 +blas +lapack +scalapack
    - gotcha@1.0.3
    - hdf5@1.10.6 +cxx +debug +fortran +szip +threadsafe
    
    # - hpctoolkit@2020.08.03 +all-static +cray +mpi  # depends on dyninst
    - hypre@2.18.2
    - kokkos-kernels@3.1.00 +mkl +openmp
    - kokkos@3.1.01 +debug +debug_dualview_modify_check +compiler_warnings +examples
      +hwloc +memkind +numactl +openmp
    - libnrm@0.1.0
    - libquo@1.3.1
    
    # - magma@2.5.3 this package requires GPU, this is not applicable for Cori
    - mercury@1.0.1
    - mpifileutils@0.10.1 +gpfs +lustre
    - mfem@4.1.0 +openmp +threadsafe
    - ninja@1.10.0
    
    #- openmpi            # skip openmpi 
    - openpmd-api@0.11.1
    - papi@6.0.0.1 +example +static_tools
    
    #- papyrus@develop        # skipping this package because it is on @develop version we need a release number
    - parallel-netcdf@1.12.1
    - pdt@3.25.1
    
    # - petsc@3.13.1 +debug +fftw ~hypre
    - py-jupyterhub@1.0.0
    - py-libensemble@0.7.0
    - qthreads@1.14 ~hwloc
    - raja@0.11.0
    
    # error building rempi https://software.nersc.gov/ecp/nersc-e4s/-/jobs/32884
    # - rempi@1.1.0
    - scr@2.0.0  async_api=CRAY_DW
    
    # - slate@develop package tied to develop skipping this build
    - stc@0.8.3
    - strumpack@4.0.0 +shared ~butterflypack ~cuda +count_flops +build_dev_tests +build_tests
    - sundials@5.3.0 +examples-cxx +examples-f2003 ~examples-f77 +f2003 +klu +openmp
    - superlu@5.2.1
    - superlu-dist@6.3.1
    - sz@2.1.8.3 +fortran +time_compression +random_access
    
    #aditya: builds stand alone
    - tasmanian@7.1 +blas +fortran +mpi +python +xsdkflags
    
    # error building otf2, we can disable tau with otf2 support 
    # - tau@2.29 +craycnl +openmp +mpi
    - trilinos@13.0.0 +debug +float +openmp +pnetcdf +zlib
    - turbine@1.2.3 +hdf5 +python
    - umpire@2.1.0 +fortran +numa +openmp
    - unifyfs@0.9.0 +hdf5
    - upcxx@2020.3.0
    - veloc@1.1
    - zfp@0.5.5 +profile

  - arch:
    - '%intel@19.1.2.254 arch=cray-cnl7-haswell'
  specs:
  - matrix:
    - - $e4s
    - - $arch

  compilers:
  - compiler:
      spec: intel@19.1.2.254
      paths:
        cc: cc
        cxx: CC
        f77: ftn
        fc: ftn
      flags: {}
      operating_system: cnl7
      target: any
      modules:
      - PrgEnv-intel
      - intel/19.1.2.254
      environment: {unset: []}
      extra_rpaths: []
  packages:
    all:
      compiler: [intel@19.1.2.254]
      target: [haswell]
      providers:
        mpi: [mpich]
        mkl: [intel-mkl, cray-libsci]
        blas: [intel-mkl, cray-libsci]
        scalapack: [intel-mkl, cray-libsci]
        pkgconfig: [pkg-config]
      version: []
      buildable: true
    mpi:
      buildable: false

      target: []
      compiler: []
      providers: {}
    mpich:

        script:

        - hostname
        - . setclonepath.sh
        - git clone ${SPACK_REPOSITORY}  ${SPACK_CLONE_PATH}
        - cd {SPACK_CLONE_PATH} && git reset 09d0623be924ad72eb63342b733c14431208c323
          --hard && cd ..
        - . ${SPACK_CLONE_PATH}/share/spack/setup-env.sh
        - rm -rf ~/.spack/mirrors.yaml
        - spack compiler find
        - spack compiler list
        
          #- spack -e . ci rebuild

        - spack ci rebuild
        - rm -rf ${SPACK_CLONE_PATH}
```

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [ ] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->
